item.title: 纸箱销售下滑引发假日购物冷淡的担忧
item.description: 纸板箱销售的长期放缓加剧了人们的担忧，即今年的假日旺季将令美国零售商失望。【原文：An extended slowdown in sales of cardboard boxes is intensifying concern that this holiday season will be a disappointing one for US retailers.】

item.title: 美国股市自解放日以来保持稳定
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 特斯拉在欧洲的月度销量再次大幅下降
item.description: 特斯拉公司在欧洲市场的销售额出现了今年以来最大幅度的下滑，这家由埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）领导的汽车制造商在欧洲市场陷入了长期低迷。【原文：Tesla Inc. posted some of its steepest sales declines this year in European markets, where the Elon Musk-led automaker is mired in a protracted slump.】

item.title: 卡尼将公布以债务为动力的预算案以重振加拿大经济
item.description: 马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）当选总理时肩负着改革加拿大经济的使命。现在，他需要向市场保证其代价。【原文：Mark Carney was elected prime minister with a mandate to transform Canada’s economy. Now he needs to assure markets about the price tag.】

item.title: 牙买加飓风保险损失预计高达 42 亿美元
item.description: 据数据公司 Verisk Analytics Inc.称，飓风梅利莎给牙买加陆上财产造成的损失目前在 22 亿美元到 42 亿美元之间。【原文：The insured costs of Hurricane Melissa’s damages to onshore property in Jamaica now range between $2.2 billion and $4.2 billion, according to data firm Verisk Analytics Inc.】

item.title: 量子公司 Xanadu 将以 36 亿美元 SPAC 交易方式上市
item.description: 仙度量子技术公司（Xanadu Quantum Technologies Inc.【原文：Xanadu Quantum Technologies Inc. said it will go public through a merger with Crane Harbor Acquisition Corp., a US special-purpose acquisition company, in a deal that values the combined business at about $3.6 billion.】

item.title: Palantir 势头不减，估值升至平流层
item.description: Palantir Technologies Inc. 高昂的估值长期以来一直令华尔街感到困惑，但投资者基本上没有理会这些呼声，反而在财报发布前推动该股再创新高。【原文：Palantir Technologies Inc.’s pricey valuation has long confounded Wall Street but investors have largely ignored those calls, instead pushing the stock to yet another record ahead of earnings.】

item.title: 与就业市场相比，美联储古尔斯比更担心通货膨胀
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长奥斯坦-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）表示，他希望看到更多的数据，然后再决定如何在央行 12 月份的会议上投票，但他警告说，他现在更关心的是通货膨胀，而不是劳动力市场。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee said he wants to see more data before making a decision about how to vote at the central bank’s December meeting, but warned he’s more concerned about inflation than the labor market right now.】

item.title: 贷款人控制 Corus Entertainment，结束亿万富翁肖斯的统治
item.description: 加拿大广播公司 Corus Entertainment Inc. 达成了债务换股权的协议，结束了亿万富翁肖氏家族数十年的控制，贷款人将接管该公司。【原文：Lenders are set to take over Canadian broadcaster Corus Entertainment Inc. after reaching an agreement to swap their debt for equity, ending decades of control by the billionaire Shaw family.】

item.title: 惠誉表示，如果意大利联合信贷银行交易结束，Amundi 将面临重大打击
item.description: 据惠誉国际评级公司（Fitch Ratings）称，如果 Amundi SA 无法续签与意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit SpA）的分销协议，该公司的盈利将可能遭受重创。【原文：Amundi SA will likely sustain a big blow to earnings if the firm is unable to renew its distribution deal with UniCredit SpA, according to Fitch Ratings.】

item.title: 德国计划提升行业前景，欧盟碳排放飙升至 80 欧元以上
item.description: 周一，在德国宣布对能源密集型产业提供新的支持，预计将提高排放量之后，欧盟碳期货升破了80欧元的关键技术位。【原文：European Union carbon futures rose through a key technical level of €80 on Monday, after Germany announced new support for energy-intensive industries that is expected to lift emissions.】

item.title: 德国储蓄银行股价创十年最大跌幅
item.description: 德国储蓄银行（Deutsche Pfandbriefbank AG）股价周一创下十年来最大跌幅。【原文：Deutsche Pfandbriefbank AG’s shares on Monday slumped the most in ten years.】

item.title: 亚马逊与 OpenAI 达成 380 亿美元交易，美股延续牛势
item.description: 周一，美国股市延续了六个月的牛市走势，亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）与 OpenAI 公司达成了一项长达数年的人工智能协议，而政府的停摆也让投资者在私人数据中寻找有关经济的线索。【原文：US stocks continued a six-month bull run on Monday as Amazon.com Inc. rolled out a years-long artificial-intelligence deal with OpenAI and the government shutdown left investors scouring private data for clues about the economy.】

item.title: 应对气候变化的混合融资正停在惊人的低水平上
item.description: 据一份最新报告称，旨在减少排放或适应气候变化的私人资本和公共资本相结合的项目停滞在一个危险的低水平上。【原文：Projects combining private and public capital to cut emissions or adapt to climate change have stalled at a dangerously low level, according to a fresh report.】

item.title: 思科推出用于在商店和工厂运行人工智能的服务器机架
item.description: 思科系统公司（Cisco Systems Inc. ）发布了一款新的一体化产品，旨在帮助零售商店、医疗机构和工厂利用单个机架设备使用人工智能，这也是该公司在人工智能领域发挥更大作用的努力的一部分。【原文：Cisco Systems Inc. unveiled a new all-in-one product that’s meant to help retail stores, health care facilities and factories use artificial intelligence with a single rack of equipment, part of the company’s push to take a bigger role in AI.】

item.title: 亚马逊与 OpenAI 签订价值 380 亿美元的协议，为其提供 Nvidia 芯片
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）的云计算部门签署了一项价值 380 亿美元的协议，将为 OpenAI 的无底计算能力需求提供一部分。【原文：Amazon.com Inc.’s cloud unit has signed a $38 billion deal to supply a slice of OpenAI’s bottomless demand for computing power.】

item.title: 罗马尼亚将收紧对外借款目标以控制债务增长
item.description: 罗马尼亚负责发行债券的最高官员表示，罗马尼亚正寻求在明年收紧国内和国外的借贷，以抑制欧盟最高的收益率，并控制公共债务的增加。【原文：Romania is seeking to tighten its borrowing over the next year both at home and abroad to curb the highest yields in the European Union and contain rising public debt, according to the top official in charge of issuance.】

item.title: 金佰利公司和伊顿公司将交易商推向 4 万亿美元的风口浪尖
item.description: 周一，交易商签署了价值超过 800 亿美元的并购协议，向有史以来第二好的一年迈进。【原文：Dealmakers inked mergers and acquisitions worth more than $80 billion on Monday as they hurtle toward their second best year on record.】

item.title: Loop 称英伟达可借助人工智能 "黄金浪潮 "实现 85 亿美元的销售额
item.description: 至少有一位分析师认为，英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp）在成为历史上首家市值突破 5 万亿美元的公司后，其估值还将增加数万亿美元。【原文：Nvidia Corp can add trillions more to its valuation after making history as the first company to ever breach a $5 trillion market capitalization, according to at least one analyst.】

item.title: 瑞银出售瑞信 AT1 法庭裁决后的首批债券
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）正在出售其首批债券，因为法院的一项判决引起了人们对这家瑞士贷款机构可能面临先前取消的 AT1 债务的质疑。【原文：UBS Group AG is selling its first bonds since a court decision raised questions about the Swiss lender’s possible exposure to previously canceled AT1 debt.】

item.title: 个人贷款激增，最危险消费者借款人排名上升
item.description: 次级信贷风险类别的消费者比例达到了 2019 年以来的新高，这表明越来越多的借款人财务状况不佳。【原文：The share of consumers in the subprime credit risk category has reached levels not seen since 2019, a sign that a growing number of borrowers are in poor financial health.】

item.title: 欧洲央行敦促在证券化改革中谨慎对待合成 SRT
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，欧洲中央银行对贷款人过度依赖合成风险转移的做法保持警惕，正在敦促发行人采用其他方式进行资产证券化。【原文：The European Central Bank, wary of lenders’ over-reliance on synthetic risk transfers, is urging issuers to use other ways of securitizing assets, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Frigoglass 的目标是到 2028 年在埃及占据约 30% 的市场份额
item.description: 英国饮料冷却器制造商 Frigoglass 集团首席执行官 Serge Joris 表示，该集团的目标是到 2028 年占据埃及近三分之一的市场份额。【原文：Frigoglass Group, the UK-based maker of beverage coolers, aims to capture almost a third of Egypt’s market by 2028, Chief Executive Officer Serge Joris said.】

item.title: 诺和诺德股价暴跌，新任首席执行官面临扭亏压力
item.description: 诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk A/S）在 2025 年之初曾是欧洲最有价值的上市公司，但肥胖的药品竞争和利润下调使该公司股票在今年遭遇了有史以来最糟糕的一年，这也给新任领导者带来了扭亏为盈的压力。【原文：Novo Nordisk A/S began 2025 as Europe’s most valuable listed firm, but obesity drug competition and profit downgrades have left the stock facing its worst year on record — putting pressure on its new leader to engineer a turnaround.】

item.title: 美联储主席米兰重申政策仍过于严格的观点
item.description: 美联储理事斯蒂芬-米兰表示，货币政策依然具有限制性，他将继续主张大幅降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran said monetary policy remains restrictive and that he will continue to advocate for outsize interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 欧佩克+显示其对石油市场份额的追求是有限度的
item.description: 生产商集团将在明年初暂停每月增产。【原文：The producers group will pause its monthly output increases early next year.】

item.title: 美国加强制裁，土耳其减少从俄罗斯购买石油
item.description: 在美国制裁莫斯科最大的两个石油生产国之后，土耳其的炼油厂开始减少购买俄罗斯原油，转而从伊拉克、利比亚、沙特阿拉伯和哈萨克斯坦等国寻求额外的原油。【原文：Turkey’s oil refiners have started cutting their purchases of Russian crude after the US sanctioned Moscow’s top two oil producers and are instead seeking extra barrels from nations including Iraq, Libya, Saudi Arabia and Kazakhstan.】

item.title: 芯片初创公司 Substrate 在寻求与台积电抗衡过程中招致质疑
item.description: 欢迎收看《深度科技》（Tech In Depth），这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，埃德-鲁德洛（Ed Ludlow）和伊恩-金（Ian King）将报道初创公司 Substrate 宣布将生产新型芯片制造设备— 和新型芯片— 这一消息所引发的怀疑，它将撼动整个行业。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ed Ludlow and Ian King report on the skepticism that has greeted startup Substrate’s announcement that it will produce new chipmaking equipment — and new chips — that can shake up the entire industry.】

item.title: 微软誓言到 2029 年在阿联酋投入 80 亿美元开发云计算和芯片
item.description: 微软公司（Microsoft Corp. ）表示，未来四年将在阿拉伯联合酋长国的数据中心、云计算和员工方面投入超过 79 亿美元，从而推动这个海湾国家成为全球技术中心的目标。【原文：Microsoft Corp. said it will spend more than $7.9 billion on data centers, cloud-computing and employees in the United Arab Emirates over the next four years, boosting the Gulf state’s goal of becoming a global technology hub.】

item.title: 美国大公司裁员引发担忧，但尚未敲响警钟
item.description: 尽管备受瞩目的公司裁员人数不断增加，但到目前为止，还没有证据表明美国的失业率急剧上升。【原文：In spite of mounting layoffs at high-profile companies, there no evidence of a dramatic increase in joblessness in the US — so far.】
